interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Larry The Cable Guy - Git-R-Done
Review Date: 2013/12/08
Store: Larry the Cable Guy  (Actor, Writer),     Michael Drumm  (Director, Producer)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Special Interests
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'With his trademark cries of "Git-er-done!" and "What the hell is this, Russia?," Larry the Cable Guy is one of country\'s funniest comedians! Now enjoy an entire DVD of this irresistible funnyman at the top of his form and guaranteed to make you laugh again and again! A star of Comedy Central\'s hit film Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie, Larry has cracked up TV viewers of Showtime, MTV, Evening at the Improv and Comic Strip Live. He\'s also well-known for his wacky, outrageous radio commentaries and for his bestselling CD, Lord, I Apologize.', 'Amazon.com', 'Redneck comedian Larry the Cable Guy (co-star of', 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie', ') kicks off his live performance on', 'Git-R-Done', 'with one of the great questions of the modern age: "Ever have an orgasm so strong you hit your head on the back of the tub?" (He expresses gratitude that the VCR didn\'t fall into the water.) A string of gay-bashing and other intemperate quips quickly follows, but Larry\'s gross jokes are a part of an intentionally foolish persona. When he cracks wise about lesbian rocker Melissa Etheridge\'s genitals, the crowd gasps, and Larry\'s oversized rube becomes the punch line. Larry\'s no less hard on his family, commenting on an obese sister who claims to have a thyroid problem: "It\'s not a thyroid problem, it\'s a 7-11 problem." On his brief career as an evangelist: "I was $150 short of bringing a stripper to the Lord." This is hick humor that sometimes gets under one\'s skin.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Larry the Cable Guy, Nicole Vinnola, J.P. Williams, Michael Drumm', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR014381244427#VG', 'Director': 'Michael Drumm', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 25, 2004', 'Actors': 'Larry the Cable Guy', 'Producers': 'J.P. Williams, Michael Drumm, Nicole Vinnola', 'Studio': 'IMAGE ENTERTAINMENT', 'Writers': 'Larry the Cable Guy', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: My wife and I love the Blue Collar Crew, all of them! Larry is always telling stupid toilet-bowl jokes and stinky humor!
Review Title: Larry Strikes Again!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Hilarious!
The Warriors [Blu-ray](Ultimate Directors cut)
Michael Beck  (Actor),     James Remar  (Actor),     Walter Hill  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['Warriors, The (BD)', "A battle of gigantic proportions is looming in the neon underground of N ew York City. The armies of the night number 100,000; they o utnumber th e police 5 to 1; and tonight they're after the Warriors - a street gang blamed unfairly for a rival gang leader's death. This contemporary actio n-adventure story takes place at night, underground, in the sub-culture of gang warfare that rages from Coney Island to Manhattan to the Bronx. Members of the Warriors fight for their lives, seek to survive in the u rban jungle and learn the meaning of loyalty. This intense and stylized film is a dazzling achievement for cinematographer Andrew Laszlo.", ']]>']

I got it for my wife, she loves it!
Blue Collar TV - Season 1, Vol. 1
Jeff Foxworthy  (Actor, Writer),     Larry the Cable Guy  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Product Description', 'The guys who had you laughing on the Blue Collar Comedy Tour - Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall and Larry the Cable Guy - bring their particular brand of hilarity to Blue Collar TV: Season 1 Volume 1. Expect a hometown buffet of TV parodies, sketches, and stand-up, celebrating everything from spouses to spoilers, Winnebagos to Waffle Houses, cheap beer to even cheaper lingerie. You are about to get a 64-oz. Big Gulp of blue collar comedy. Are you ready?', 'DVD Features:', 'Documentary', 'Other', 'Amazon.com', 'Blue Collar TV', 'finds three of the boys from', 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie', 'and', 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again', 'in a sketch comedy format, supported by a talented ensemble of comic players and writers who know how to build on the stars\' individual strengths. Jeff Foxworthy is the series\' anchor, opening each episode in the 1994 debut season with a strong monologue riffing on one or another theme: marriage, bad jobs, sports, vacations, family, partying. Happy redneck Larry the Cable Guy and NASCAR-loving Everyman Bill Engvall join Foxworthy in energetic skits that definitely become funnier and bolder with each new show. Among the best sketches is "CSI: Greater Greensboro Tri-Area," in which Foxworthy\'s crime-scene sleuth is on the trail of a deerslayer. "Lingerie for Couples Together 20 Years" spotlights such hot domestic garb as sweatshirts accented with a ratty, cat-hair-covered blanket from the back of a closet. "Hug or Hit" is a mock game show in which a terrified contestant has to predict whether a drunk sleeping in a glass booth will, upon awakening, embrace or take a swing at him.', 'The recurring "I believe" format finds Foxworthy, Larry, and Engvall piously revealing articles of their faith in this hard, hard world: "I believe," Engvall says, "that Angelina Jolie thinks about me as much as I think about her." Right. Guest star Ron White (the missing fourth partner from the', 'Blue Collar', "tours), cigarette and Scotch-on-the-rocks in hand, lends his decadent (and welcome) persona here and there to the proceedings. Drew Carey shows up as well, but it's the series' obvious growth over 13 episodes that makes", 'Blue Collar TV', 'a comedy success.', '--Tom Keogh']
{'Genre': 'Documentary, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Larry the Cable Guy, Adam Weiss, Nathan Wright, Tom Park, Ron White, Kurt Heydle, Ashley Eckstein, Adam Small, AmyKathryn Jones, Kathy Katz, Bill Engvall, Ted Kenney, Heath Hyche, Peter Oldring, Brooke Dillman, Ayda Field, Fax Bahr, Gary Anthony Williams, Jeff FoxworthyLarry the Cable Guy, Adam Weiss, Nathan Wright, Tom Park, Ron White, Kurt Heydle, Ashley Eckstein, Adam Small, AmyKathryn Jones, Kathy Katz, Bill Engvall, Ted Kenney, Heath Hyche, Peter Oldring, Brooke Dillman, Ayda Field, Fax Bahr, Gary Anthony Williams, Jeff Foxworthy   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '5 hours and 2 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '5 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Jeff Foxworthy, Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, Brooke Dillman, Nathan Wright', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Kathy Katz, Ted Kenney, Tom Park', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'Adam Small, Fax Bahr, Jeff Foxworthy', 'Number of discs': '2'}
I like good redneck humor and this is it! You might be a redneck if.....FUNNY! Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall and Larry the Cable Guy have done it again with a lot of laughs smash hit and of course, some redneck humor! Freakin funnier than ever yee hahah!
Great Redneck Humor!
Blue Collar TV: Season 1, Vol. 2
Jeff Foxworthy  (Actor, Writer),     Larry The Cable Guy  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['If you thought the Vol. 1 Blue Collar TV DVD was as welcome and satisfying as ham and red-eye gravy, you\'re only half right. \'Cause this Vol. 2 set (3 discs, 18 episodes) completes the Season 1 fun and, like the previous volume, builds each episode around a theme ? like "The Human Body," "Christmas" or "Gadgets." Pass that gravy and stay awhile, friends. Y\'all gonna have some right-good laughs.']

Ron White: A Little Unprofessional
Ron White  (Actor),     Tom Forest  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
["Ron 'Tater Salad' White has been Drunk in Public. He Tried to Fix Stupid. No one argues that he has Behavioral Problems, and now he is 'A Little Unprofessional'. with cigar in one hand and a glass of scotch in the other, the Grammy-Nominated Blue Collar Comedy Tour alum delivers more than an hour of all new material with is signature, irreverent storytelling style and the best comedic timing in the business. Filmed live at the Paramount Theater in Austin, TX."]

Ron White: Behavioral Problems
Ron White  (Actor),     Michael Drumm  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, The Comedy Central Store, Stand Up
['BLUE COLLAR COMEDY star Ron White ups the ante with this raucous comedy special that covers all the hot topics. First aired on Comedy Central, BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS features the irrepressible comic in the spotlight, cigar in hand, telling it like it is. Special Features: Letterbox - 1.85 Audio: Dolby Digital 5.1, Stereo Subtitles English.']
{'Genre': 'Comedy/Stand-Up', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ron White, Michael Drumm', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5070817', 'Director': 'Michael Drumm', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 21, 2009', 'Actors': 'Ron White', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Comedy Central', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
My wife and I love the Blue Collar Crew, all of them! Mr.White is keen and witty for a guy that drinks the way he does recalling various accounts of being kick of out bar for wearing a cowboy hat, to using such educated vocabulary terms such as "fraught" and "shat whole" and making references to gingko bilova, and all the while claiming his childhood was educationally limited. You're smarter than you let on Mr. White! Just keep drinking
Ron White is the best drunk to perform in Public since the late great Foster Brooks!

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user continues to have a strong affinity for comedy, particularly stand-up and variety shows that feature redneck humor. Their appreciation for established and emerging talents highlights a preference for ensemble casts that deliver relatable and humorous content.

- **Format Preference:** The user’s passion for tangible media remains evident, as they actively purchase DVDs to enhance their personal collection, demonstrating a commitment to physical formats.

- **Engagement with Artists:** They engage deeply with comedians who resonate on cultural and personal levels, with notable enthusiasm for performers known for their everyday humor. 

- **Rating Pattern:** The user consistently awards high ratings, often giving perfect scores to performances that strongly align with their comedic preferences, indicating a discerning yet appreciative taste in humor.

- **Review Style:** Their reviews are characterized by personal insights and humor, skillfully blending critiques with enthusiastic narratives reflecting their comedic experiences.

- **Exploration of Other Genres:** While comedy is the primary focus, the user remains open to family-friendly films, ensuring that content is suitable for shared viewing with their wife and daughter.

- **Family Engagement:** The user actively balances their personal interests with family preferences, showcasing a proactive approach to selecting enjoyable content for collective entertainment experiences, as seen in their recent interaction that includes a favorite comedic figure.
